intro: Horkelia frondosa, commonly known as the frondosa horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and meadows. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Horkelia frondosa is often found in regions with mild, moist climates and is considered a rare or endangered species in some areas.
